intro: Bupleurum rigidum proles robustum, commonly known as the robust bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, somewhat woody stems and pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clustered inflorescences during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Bupleurum rigidum proles robustum is often found in alpine and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
